    • addUser

      public UserResponse addUser​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, Body5 body) throws ApiException
      Create a user Adds a new user to the account. The user may be configured as an admin or standard user, and (if a standard user) may be assigned a restricted [home directory](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#setting-the-user-s-home-directory) and restricted [permissions](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions). **Notes:** - You must be an [admin-level user](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to use this.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      body - (optional)
      Returns:
      UserResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • deleteUser

      public EmptyResponse deleteUser​(java.math.BigDecimal id, java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken) throws ApiException
      Delete a user Delete a user from the account. Deleting a user does **NOT** delete any files from the account; it merely removes a user's access. Aternatively, locking a user via the [PATCH /users/{id}](#operation/updateUser) will keep the user in your account, but make it unable to log in. Resources and shares owned by the deleted user will be owned by the master user after the deletion. **Notes:** - You must have [admin-level access](/docs/account/04-users/01-admin-users) to delete a user. - The primary owner of the account cannot be deleted.
      Parameters:
      id - The user's ID. Note that this is our internal ID, and _not the username_. You can obtain it by calling the [GET /users](#operation/listUsers) method. (required)
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      Returns:
      EmptyResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

Resources and shares owned by the deleted user will be owned by the master user after the deletion. **Notes:** - You must have [admin-level access](/docs/account/04-users/01-admin-users) to delete a user. - The primary owner of the account cannot be deleted.

Resources and shares owned by the deleted user will be owned by the master user after the deletion. **Notes:** - You must have [admin-level access](/docs/account/04-users/01-admin-users) to delete a user. - The primary owner of the account cannot be deleted.

    • listUsersCall

      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call listUsersCall​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String role, java.lang.Integer status, java.lang.String homeDir, java.lang.String search, java.lang.Integer offset, java.lang.String sort, java.lang.Integer limit, java.lang.String include, ProgressResponseBody.ProgressListener progressListener, ProgressRequestBody.ProgressRequestListener progressRequestListener) throws ApiException
      Build call for listUsers
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      username - The username of the user you are looking for. Only entries with the same username as this will be in the list of results. Does not support wildcard searches. (optional)
      nickname - Nickname to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      email - Email to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches (optional)
      role - Types of users to include the list. Ignored if `username` is provided. Valid options are **admin**, **master** and **user** (optional)
      status - Whether a user is locked. Ignored if `username` is provided. **0** means user is locked, **1** means user is not locked. (optional)
      homeDir - Path for user's home directory. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      search - Searches the nickname, email, role and homeDir fields for the provided value. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      offset - Starting user record in the result set. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      sort - Sort order or matching users. You can sort by multiple columns by separating sort options with a comma; the sort will be applied in the order specified. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending. Valid sort fields are: **nickname**, **username**, **email**, **homeDir** and **modified** (optional)
      limit - Number of users to return. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      include - Comma separated list of relationships to include in response. Valid options are **homeResource** and **ownerAccount**. (optional)
      progressListener - Progress listener
      progressRequestListener - Progress request listener
      Returns:
      Call to execute
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object

    • listUsers

      public UserCollectionResponse listUsers​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String role, java.lang.Integer status, java.lang.String homeDir, java.lang.String search, java.lang.Integer offset, java.lang.String sort, java.lang.Integer limit, java.lang.String include) throws ApiException
      Get a list of users Get a list of the users in your account. There are three main types of searches you can do with this method: 1. Search for a user by username. If you provide the `username` parameter in your call, then only the user who exactly matches that username will be in the list of matches. Any other parameters are ignored. 1. Search for a user by individual filter fields (`nickname`,`email`,`role`,`status`,`homeDir`). Users in the list will be ones who match all of the filters you choose to search by. For example, you could look for users with the \"admin\" `role` AND `email` addresses ending in \"*@acme.com\". 1. Search for a user by search string. If you provide the `search` parameter, users whose nickname OR email OR role OR homeDir match value your provide. **Notes:** - You must be an [admin-level user](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to use this. - The homeDir is the full path to the user's home directory, not a resource ID or hash.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      username - The username of the user you are looking for. Only entries with the same username as this will be in the list of results. Does not support wildcard searches. (optional)
      nickname - Nickname to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      email - Email to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches (optional)
      role - Types of users to include the list. Ignored if `username` is provided. Valid options are **admin**, **master** and **user** (optional)
      status - Whether a user is locked. Ignored if `username` is provided. **0** means user is locked, **1** means user is not locked. (optional)
      homeDir - Path for user's home directory. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      search - Searches the nickname, email, role and homeDir fields for the provided value. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      offset - Starting user record in the result set. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      sort - Sort order or matching users. You can sort by multiple columns by separating sort options with a comma; the sort will be applied in the order specified. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending. Valid sort fields are: **nickname**, **username**, **email**, **homeDir** and **modified** (optional)
      limit - Number of users to return. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      include - Comma separated list of relationships to include in response. Valid options are **homeResource** and **ownerAccount**. (optional)
      Returns:
      UserCollectionResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • listUsersWithHttpInfo

      public ApiResponse<UserCollectionResponse> listUsersWithHttpInfo​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String role, java.lang.Integer status, java.lang.String homeDir, java.lang.String search, java.lang.Integer offset, java.lang.String sort, java.lang.Integer limit, java.lang.String include) throws ApiException
      Get a list of users Get a list of the users in your account. There are three main types of searches you can do with this method: 1. Search for a user by username. If you provide the `username` parameter in your call, then only the user who exactly matches that username will be in the list of matches. Any other parameters are ignored. 1. Search for a user by individual filter fields (`nickname`,`email`,`role`,`status`,`homeDir`). Users in the list will be ones who match all of the filters you choose to search by. For example, you could look for users with the \"admin\" `role` AND `email` addresses ending in \"*@acme.com\". 1. Search for a user by search string. If you provide the `search` parameter, users whose nickname OR email OR role OR homeDir match value your provide. **Notes:** - You must be an [admin-level user](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to use this. - The homeDir is the full path to the user's home directory, not a resource ID or hash.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      username - The username of the user you are looking for. Only entries with the same username as this will be in the list of results. Does not support wildcard searches. (optional)
      nickname - Nickname to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      email - Email to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches (optional)
      role - Types of users to include the list. Ignored if `username` is provided. Valid options are **admin**, **master** and **user** (optional)
      status - Whether a user is locked. Ignored if `username` is provided. **0** means user is locked, **1** means user is not locked. (optional)
      homeDir - Path for user's home directory. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      search - Searches the nickname, email, role and homeDir fields for the provided value. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      offset - Starting user record in the result set. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      sort - Sort order or matching users. You can sort by multiple columns by separating sort options with a comma; the sort will be applied in the order specified. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending. Valid sort fields are: **nickname**, **username**, **email**, **homeDir** and **modified** (optional)
      limit - Number of users to return. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      include - Comma separated list of relationships to include in response. Valid options are **homeResource** and **ownerAccount**. (optional)
      Returns:
      ApiResponse<UserCollectionResponse>
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • listUsersAsync

      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call listUsersAsync​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String role, java.lang.Integer status, java.lang.String homeDir, java.lang.String search, java.lang.Integer offset, java.lang.String sort, java.lang.Integer limit, java.lang.String include, ApiCallback<UserCollectionResponse> callback) throws ApiException
      Get a list of users (asynchronously) Get a list of the users in your account. There are three main types of searches you can do with this method: 1. Search for a user by username. If you provide the `username` parameter in your call, then only the user who exactly matches that username will be in the list of matches. Any other parameters are ignored. 1. Search for a user by individual filter fields (`nickname`,`email`,`role`,`status`,`homeDir`). Users in the list will be ones who match all of the filters you choose to search by. For example, you could look for users with the \"admin\" `role` AND `email` addresses ending in \"*@acme.com\". 1. Search for a user by search string. If you provide the `search` parameter, users whose nickname OR email OR role OR homeDir match value your provide. **Notes:** - You must be an [admin-level user](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to use this. - The homeDir is the full path to the user's home directory, not a resource ID or hash.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      username - The username of the user you are looking for. Only entries with the same username as this will be in the list of results. Does not support wildcard searches. (optional)
      nickname - Nickname to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      email - Email to search for. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches (optional)
      role - Types of users to include the list. Ignored if `username` is provided. Valid options are **admin**, **master** and **user** (optional)
      status - Whether a user is locked. Ignored if `username` is provided. **0** means user is locked, **1** means user is not locked. (optional)
      homeDir - Path for user's home directory. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      search - Searches the nickname, email, role and homeDir fields for the provided value. Ignored if `username` is provided. Supports wildcard searches. (optional)
      offset - Starting user record in the result set. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      sort - Sort order or matching users. You can sort by multiple columns by separating sort options with a comma; the sort will be applied in the order specified. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending. Valid sort fields are: **nickname**, **username**, **email**, **homeDir** and **modified** (optional)
      limit - Number of users to return. Can be used for pagination. (optional)
      include - Comma separated list of relationships to include in response. Valid options are **homeResource** and **ownerAccount**. (optional)
      callback - The callback to be executed when the API call finishes
      Returns:
      The request call
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to process the API call, e.g. serializing the request body object

    • updateUserCall

    • updateUser

      public UserResponse updateUser​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.math.BigDecimal id, Body6 body) throws ApiException
      Update a user Updates the settings for the user. Note that the unique key for this API call is our internal ID, and _not_ the username, as the username can be changed. In the request body, you should only send the parameters for values that you wish to change for the user. **Notes:** - You must have [admin or master](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) access to edit other users. If you have user-level access, you can only update your own user settings. - You cannot edit a master user with this method.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - The user's ID. Note that this is our internal ID, and _not the username_. You can obtain it by calling the [GET /users](#operation/listUsers) method. (required)
      body - (optional)
      Returns:
      UserResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body
